pullRequest.title: Feature/inspect and refactor netbeans
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of the Change
These are some code cleanup changes utilising NetBean's > Refactor > Inspect and Refactor options. This PR has changed many files and has a lot of changes in it (which I am planning on committing now without anyone's review) 😨 to form the baseline for v2 and testing v2. This PR is to let everyone know I did this. Obviously if there are is anything in hear you don't like then lets discuss here afterwards and happy to revert any of the changes.
For the explicit changes refer to each commit I did but the following are changes I've made:

Remove unused imports
Performance Improvements

Used the NetBeans Inspect and Refactor option and ran through all possible performance options and pretty much implemented them all.


Inspect and refactor (NetBeans option)

Convert to switch over Strings
Remove .floatValue()
Remove .intValue()
Convert to for-loop (skipped some)
Some lambda expression (skipped some)
Repalce with multicatch
Use member reference (skipped some)
Convert to try with resoruce


Organise imports
Auto format code
Remove unused help jar

One thing to note is that I've included some Java 11 changes too like if { } else switch () {} a couple of times.
Alternate Designs

Why Should This Be In Core?

Benefits

Easier to read code
Utilise automated workflows to improve code (using NetBeans's build in features)

Possible Drawbacks

Verification Process

I have run the unit tests
Explicitly tested changes to the classes for non trivial changes

Applicable Issues

commit.message:
:art: Inspect and refactor (NetBeans option)
* Convert to switch over Strings
* Remove .floatValue()
* Remove .intValue()
* Convert to for-loop (skipped some)
* Some lambda expression (skipped some)
* Repalce with multicatch
* Use member reference (skipped some)
* Convert to try with resoruce

:race_horse: Performance Improvements
Used the NetBeans Inspect and Refactor option and ran through all possible performance options and pretty much implemented them all.

nodes.bodyText: I might be being picky, but would it be better to have null on the RHS of the argument?
